alert.note: Alert for Baldwin; Hancock; Putnam; Warren (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 26 at 2:29PM EDT until March 26 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHERN BALDWIN, SOUTHEASTERN PUTNAM, HANCOCK AND WARREN COUNTIES... At 229 PM EDT, While the widespread heavy rain has ended, areas of moderate to heavy rain continue. In addition, runoff from previous heavy rain will still cause larger creeks and rivers to rise. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen since 8 AM. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to continue. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Milledgeville, Warrenton, Sparta, Norwood, Camak, Meriwether, Springfield, Culverton, Shoulderbone, Powelton, Devereux, Mayfield, Jewell, Shoals, Underwood, Beall Springs, Oconee Springs Park, Plant Harlee Branch, Cadley and Reese. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
